title: Outdoor Physical Education Pedagogy Design and Mathematical Analysis for Elementary Physical Education in the Pandemic Era

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary education curriculum and physical education subject fundamentals, mobile device utilization skills, basic statistical and graph interpretation abilities
context.additional_context: Microlearning implementation using smartphones in PC-unavailable environments (exercise data collection/analysis), strengthening practical application skills through project-based assessment (exercise effect measurement and result comparison)

learning_goals: Learners develop lesson design skills reflecting core competencies of elementary physical education (collaboration, physical development, safety management) during pandemics and apply mathematical calculations for measuring exercise intensity.

Learners develop and practice at least three outdoor exercise education strategies applicable in limited spaces (space optimization, exercise frequency/intensity formulation, safe distance calculation).

Learners create a plan for operating physical education classes using smartphone-based microlearning content, including exercise data visualization, graph analysis, and personalized progress tracking.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
